WRITING.TEXT:
I also did a democratic greece game where mountaineer/infart divisions took down the entire axis with 55% war participation (coat of arms on repeat roleplay). Same strat (exclusively air and inf production) however this is slightly different as most of the axis troops were fighting elsewhere including soviets whereas in the france game I was fighting the entire main axis force with just infart and beat them before soviets even got involved and also beat the soviets after
note: **I did not even use anti tank guns in either of these campaigns**

WRITING.TITLE: Are tanks too weak?
WRITING.TEXT:
I just did a democratic france game where I beat the axis and soviets with just infantry and artillery and air force.
This should imo not be realistic at all for a "high medium" population country like france to do.
I strongly feel that tanks should be a required inclusion in a 1940s and onwards army if you are going up against countries like the axis and the soviets.
Then I thought maybe this is the reason why the axis are weak in this game? maybe their tanks are keeping them down because tanks are so under tuned in the game?
what are your thoughts?

Yesterday was International Women's Day. This is a day to celebrate womens achievements, recognise challenges, and focus attention on womens rights, womens representation and their adequate resources. Our experience is that womens rights do not only benefit women, but society as a whole.
More than 20 years ago, in 1994, the International Conference on Population and Development met here in Cairo to discuss various issues, including education of women and protection of women from all forms of violence, including female genital mutilation and sexual harassment. Many of these issues are still very much in play today and I urge you to contribute to upholding the agreements made here in Cairo 20 years ago.

I'm not trying to question the legitimacy of the democratic side at all. I mean that for every generation turkey, like russia, has to struggle against an anti-democratic tendency, just as sweden has to struggle against a xenophobic tendency or america against a militarist tendency, to different degrees of success. In this sense they have an electorate that gravitates in a particular direction. I doesn't have to mean that the majority in each country supports that side, but I mean that that side naturally gains supporters in every new generation despite the best efforts of schooling/education and media

is military spending a republican or democratic pursuit in your opinion?
Just as america has a militarist electorate, turkey and russia have anti-democratic electorates and Sweden has a xenophobic electorate (and rightly so imo, being swedish myself)
Sure there are americans (on the coasts and in cities) who want less military spending and fewer wars, but the main drive of the american electorate will never scale down military spending or change the nature of US foreign policy.
